title.narrative: 1.8. IMMUNIZATION

description.narrative: By the end of 2015, polio eradication certification criteria, pre-measles elimination, elimination of Neonatal Tetanus and control of yellow fever's objectives are reached, which contributes to Immunization, Polio Eradication. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children and women - especially in the most vulnerable households - are have access to a package of high-impact interventions for child survival

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2015, polio eradication certification criteria, pre-measles elimination, elimination of Neonatal Tetanus and controlof yellow fever?s objectives are reached

description.narrative: Since July 2011, Cote d&39;Ivoire has stopped the circulation of wild polio virus and has been certified polio free in December 2015 and UNICEF supported reaching pre-measles elimination, elimination of Neonatal Tetanus and control of yellow fever&39;s objectives | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2017

title.narrative: Health districts reporting at least one suspect case of disease (with a sample)

baseline.value: 0 poliovirus cases, Health District Percentage reported at least one suspected case with a sample

actual.value: 2015:Certified polio free% health districts having reported at least one suspect case:-Acute flaccid paralysis: 99% (81/82)-Measles: 94% (77/82)-Yellow fever: 89% (73/82)-Neonatal Tetanus: 8.5% (7/82)

title.narrative: Proportion of appropriate responses to outbreaks
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) IPV introduced into routine immunization schedules and country switched from trivalent Oral Polio Vaccine (tOPV) to bivalent Oral Polio Vaccine (bOPV)
